# Program Overview

The BYU Associate Product Manager (APM) Internships are for-credit, apprenticeship-style internships designed for high-performing undergraduate students majoring in Strategic Management at Brigham Young University.

Students work on real product and product-adjacent initiatives at company partners while earning academic credit toward their degree.

## Program At a Glance

| | |
|---|---|
| **Duration** | 4 months |
| **Period** | January 7 – April 15, 2026 |
| **Hours** | 10-20 hours per week |
| **Credit** | 3.0-6.0 credit hours |
| **Location** | In-person or remote |

## I'm a Student

Get started with your APM internship:

- [Syllabus](students/01-syllabus.qmd) — Grading, policies, and course information
- [Getting Started](students/02-getting-started.qmd) — Onboarding checklist and expectations

Students in this program typically complete [STRAT 412 – Strategy Prototyping](https://byu-strategy.github.io/strategy-prototyping/) to build foundational product management skills before their internship.
